trans-unit.source: Specifies the visibility of a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ScrollBar"></xref> for scrollable content.

Use this enumeration to set the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ScrollViewer.HorizontalScrollBarVisibility%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ScrollViewer.VerticalScrollBarVisibility%2A> property values of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ScrollViewer> control.
The member values of this enumeration specify <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ScrollBar> visibility in a given direction.
These member values also specify whether the corresponding <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ScrollViewer> dimension is applied to its enclosed content.

When you apply the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ScrollViewer.ViewportWidth%2A> or <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ScrollViewer.ViewportHeight%2A> to <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ScrollViewer> content, you set the viewport size for the content.

A <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ScrollBar"></xref> appears and the dimension of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ScrollViewer"></xref> is applied to the content when the viewport cannot display all of the content.

For a horizontal <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ScrollBar"></xref>, the width of the content is set to the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ScrollViewer.ViewportWidth"></xref> of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ScrollViewer"></xref>.

For a vertical <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ScrollBar"></xref>, the height of the content is set to the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ScrollViewer.ViewportHeight"></xref> of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ScrollViewer"></xref>.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ScrollBar"></xref> does not appear even when the viewport cannot display all of the content.
The dimension of the content is set to the corresponding dimension of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ScrollViewer"></xref> parent.

For a horizontal <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ScrollBar"></xref>, the width of the content is set to the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ScrollViewer.ViewportWidth"></xref> of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ScrollViewer"></xref>.

For a vertical <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ScrollBar"></xref>, the height of the content is set to the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ScrollViewer.ViewportHeight"></xref> of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ScrollViewer"></xref>.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ScrollBar"></xref> does not appear even when the viewport cannot display all of the content.
The dimension of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ScrollViewer"></xref> is not applied to the content.
The dimension of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ScrollViewer"></xref> is applied to the content.

For a horizontal <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ScrollBar"></xref>, the width of the content is set to the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ScrollViewer.ViewportWidth"></xref> of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ScrollViewer"></xref>.

For a vertical <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ScrollBar"></xref>, the height of the content is set to the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ScrollViewer.ViewportHeight"></xref> of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ScrollViewer"></xref>.
